body_html:
@ezyang Found the problem, because input parameters is a generator, during sanity check, it calls for loop which damages original pointer. And in Python it is a bit tricky a clone a generator and also can be expensive.

So I guess it is okay without dimensionality check as current implementation works correctly even if the input vector has more values than that of in the parameters. Thus I propose to close this PR, What do you think ?
body_text:
@ezyang Found the problem, because input parameters is a generator, during sanity check, it calls for loop which damages original pointer. And in Python it is a bit tricky a clone a generator and also can be expensive.
So I guess it is okay without dimensionality check as current implementation works correctly even if the input vector has more values than that of in the parameters. Thus I propose to close this PR, What do you think ?
body:
@ezyang Found the problem, because input `parameters` is a generator, during sanity check, it calls for loop which damages original pointer. And in Python it is a bit tricky a clone a generator and also can be expensive. 

So I guess it is okay without dimensionality check as current implementation works correctly even if the input vector has more values than that of in the parameters. Thus I propose to close this PR, What do you think ?
